restore.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make something return to its former state or condition
restore.translation[0].definitions[0].no: restore somebody’s sight/hearing (=make someone who cannot hear or who is blind, hear or see again)
restore.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
The National Guard was called in to restore order (=make people stop fighting and breaking the law) when riots broke out.
initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
Vietnam restored diplomatic relations with South Korea on December 22.
The government promises to restore the economy to full strength.
restore.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to bring back a positive feeling that a person or a group of people felt before
restore.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: measures aimed at restoring public confidence in the education system
a man whose kindness and sincerity really restored my faith in human nature  (=helped me to believe that people can be good)
restore.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to repair an old building, piece of furniture, or painting etc so that it is in its original condition
restore.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The church was carefully restored after the war.
a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
restore.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to give back to someone something that was lost or taken from them
restore.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
restore.translation[0].definitions[3].no: In everyday English, people usually say that someone gives something back to its former owner, rather than restores it:
The treaty gave Okinawa back to Japan.
restore.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to bring back a law, tax, right etc
restore.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: a campaign to restore the death penalty
restore.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make something return to its former level or condition
restore.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The government’s first task will be to restore the economy.
a bid to restore the company to profitability
restore.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make a situation or feeling exist again
restore.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Without fundamental reforms, the profitability of the banking system will not be restored.
Hoping to restore investor confidence, the company replaced the head of its credit unit.
restore.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to give something back, especially money that is owed
restore.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The government agreed to restore an estimated $120 million that had been cut from the Energy Department budget.
